website_summaries.verdict: Appearance surpasses functionality, but it still has a lot to offer, including a heavy-duty build. The best value for your money.
pros: Weather-resistant steel construction holds up for years of use
Capable of watering lots of plants without refilling
cons: The sprinkling head is not removable, and the plastic handle covering is flimsy

customer_reviews.title: Good quality except two issues.
customer_reviews.text: I like it except for two things. 1) I use it outside in the garden and it takes over 60 seconds for the bucket to drain. I wish it would come with two heads: one of which has larger holes. I suppose I could drill them out but that would compromise the galvanization. 2) the plastic part of handle broken in less than a month. It's not required but using the bucket without it will dig into your hand. It should be made from wood or some more substantial the plastic because the weight of the bucket breaks it quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Best Watering Can Ever. Period.
customer_reviews.text: I've used a lot of watering cans over the years and, frankly, the all fell short. Only two good things can be said for plastice watering cans: they're lightweight and they can usually be recycled. But this review isn't about the failings of plastic watering cans. I decided this year that I wanted to buy a real watering can. I got one. Because of the pail-type handle, it's precise in its handling. The sprinkler head, while permanently attached, is just right. I've read other reviews complaining of roughness. If you know anything about plating steel, you understand that it isn't always perfect. I cannot imagine a better steel watering can for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Martin W. Novak

customer_reviews.title: They rust really bad and turn the water rusty.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a couple of these and figured nothing could go wrong. They are cute and would be great for decor (if that is your style), BUT the inside rusts so bad it is ridiculous. Any water that is left in the can rusts the inner walls, white makes the water turn to rusty sludge. Really gross. I have thrown them both away. Back to the drawing board.
customer_reviews.author: Dallas shopper

customer_reviews.title: It takes a lot for me to give only one star. DISAPPOINTED
customer_reviews.text: I didn't see the commentary about the rose no longer being removable or I would have reconsidered this purchase. It arrived today, I filled it, and water gushes out of a gap between the threads where the rose is apparently soldered on. Since this is not made to be removed, I can't unscrew it and put on teflon tape or something comparable. I've had great luck with many other Behren's products, but this is a non-starter.
customer_reviews.author: A Close Reader

customer_reviews.title: Great cans!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best watering cans! I bought one to check it out and immediately bought two more, one for each hosebib. I took the plastic ones to the goodwill. The spouts on this metal can will not crack or break, the metal is heavy gauge and would be difficult to dent, and the galvanizing is nice and thick. They hold a nice amount of water, and the handle allows for pivoting the can to pour instead of all the wrist pressure. I should have bought these many years ago. They are a bit more expensive but well worth it. I painted some doodles on one with model paint.
customer_reviews.author: mike faler

customer_reviews.title: Leaked all over on the first fill! terrible quality!
customer_reviews.text: I have zero patience for poor quality. This thing arrived leaking as if it had no seams. Great. Now I can take time from my day to lug a big box and wait in line at the post office for a “free” replacement and risk it again, at my cost to purchase and return? I filled this to use it the first time and water began leaking all over my floor and me and my kitchen. Come on... is there zero quality control? I don’t recommend this unless you’re willing to gamble with a leaking mess and the joy of a return.
customer_reviews.author: CowgirlyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Watered down!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watering can twenty years ago. It was 5 Star. My new can is of terrible quality. The galvanized steel is thin. The white plastic piece on the handle is gone, forcing me to wear gloves to carry. Sharp edges to cut yourself again requiring gloves. And for the coup de gras, the can came with a dent on the side! The only positive is it holds water, but for how long! Bring it back to America!
customer_reviews.author: david m jones

customer_reviews.title: a good pro quality watering can with one drawback.
customer_reviews.text: Could be five star if they went back to the original, removable rose design. This looks like it should screw off, but doesn't. Seems to be galvanized in place. The rose needs to be removable for easy cleaning, Otherwise this might be the best watering can of this capacity available. There is no comparison between this and one of those smaller plastic cans. This is much better. There is nothing wrong with plastic as it is corrosion proof, but most of the plastic cans are too flimsy if you need large volume.
customer_reviews.author: Newton Fawcett

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS THING
customer_reviews.text: This is an AMERICAN made product, made by American Hands with American quality. If you want a plastic injected mold that comes from wherever this is definitely NOT for you. But if you're wanting something that hands here in this country made that unfortunately is from a dying art form (tin making), then this awesome product is definitely for you. It is sturdy, well-balanced and has different handles from which to pour. It's like having your own little thunderstorm in a can! HIGHLY recommend this. Oh... did I mention it was made here in America? Well, it is.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey

customer_reviews.title: great watering can
customer_reviews.text: great and well made watering can, but i don't like the swinging top handle. I took it off and replaced it with a PVC rigid handle going from back to front. it works much better with my handle. its easier to carry and use with the PVC handle.
customer_reviews.author: D. RIOS

customer_reviews.title: A bit dissappointed
customer_reviews.text: Nice watering can...but the junkie white plastic handle grip should be wood. We are going to cut it off , drill out a wood dowel rod, cut that in half , sand it up, and glue it back together with waterproof glue. The one main part you come in contact with...and they use crappy low end plastic. It is not even heavy duty. Imagine carrying a full can of water with no plastic ...thats what you will eventually have.
customer_reviews.author: mike s

customer_reviews.title: Quality Construction, But Had To Drill The Spray Holes
customer_reviews.text: Great watering can. Well constructed and holds 21⁄2 gallons. Two issues: * The spray head is threaded on (great!) but then is staked by the manufacturer to prevent removal (why?). This prevents removing the head to clean out any debris trapped in the spray head. * The holes in the spray head were VERY tiny. Suitable for gently watering newly planted seed beds without disturbing the soil, but just about useless for watering established plantings with any kind of speed. I had to drill the spray holes out to the next size to get the flow rate up. Easily done and now I have the perfect watering can.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Works well with modifications.
customer_reviews.text: Where the water nozzle attaches to the spout had a leak thus the 3 stars. It hadn't been soldered well. In the past the nozzle could be removed by screwing it off of the spout but the nozzle is permanently attached on these new versions. So I took the advice of some here who had used a hacksaw to cut the nozzle off. Now it pours better in one single stream instead of a leaky spray. Other than that detail the watering can is well made, ergonomic, seems durable and holds the right amount of water without being too heavy. If not for the permanently attached nozzle I would have given 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jubal

customer_reviews.title: Too wide of a spray pattern to be useful
customer_reviews.text: The spray pattern was 20" wide. This is too wide to water a garden row, flower, flower pot... I really cannot think of practical use for this spray pattern. If you read other reviews, you see talk of replacing the head (mine was crimped on).
customer_reviews.author: R. Powlus

customer_reviews.title: Was very disappointed that the head is crimped on
customer_reviews.text: Was very disappointed that the head is crimped on, and can't be screwed off/on. Picture shows threads and you can even buy replacement heads from Behrens, and I never even considered that the head would be crimped on instead of screwed on. I could find cans like this (only plastic) that had non-removable heads all over the place locally. Too much hassle to return, but I would never have purchased it I had known the head was permanently attached. Amazon needs to update their description of this item. Have not had any leaking problems as others have mentioned, but it is still annoying that I paid more than I could have locally for the same type of can.
customer_reviews.author: vlnohio

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy these!
customer_reviews.text: This is supposed to be galvanized. I've only had it for approximately a little over a year. The pour spout is already rusted. I bought 2 of these for approx $25 each. What a waste of money. I could have purchased plastic
customer_reviews.author: Huette

customer_reviews.title: This is almost perfect for watering my garden
customer_reviews.text: I have a rain barrel and I've tried running a hose from it but the pressure is too low to do more than just drain it into my grass. So, I opted to try this watering can. It is the perfect size to get a raised bed watered, the opening is the perfect size to fill from my rain barrel, but I'm a little upset that the diffuser is not removable because I got a little soil in it and clogged the diffuser. Banging and flushing with water is the only way I could get it clean. other than that, this watering can is the best. I love Behren's brand metal thingies
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Love this watering can
customer_reviews.text: We have gone through two plastic watering cans: sprinkler heads warping or falling off, and decided to go for metal. This can is STURDY! It's big - but easy to handle - with a wide and even sprinkling area. It sounds crazy to love a watering can, but yeah... this is lovable! When I use it, I actually get this fun memory of being back on my grandparent's farm, oh so many years ago. I have no clue whether they owned something similar, but it sure feels as though it belonged there!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good "Old Tech"
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a good old fashioned watering can for the container plants and this one comes pretty close. The plastic ones just fall apart, and end up in the ocean. I drilled out the spout holes a bit, to let the water flow a little faster, but that might just be me. The can seems well made. Behrens has been fabricating galvanized metal for a long time. I have several large stock tanks by them, too. This watering can is fairly large at 2.5 gallons, which is what I wanted, so I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I've had this watering can maybe four or five months. I use it to water plants twice a day. I am very happy with its size. Even when you fill it quite high, it doesn't spill out of the top or the spout. It is all metal and has held up great. I have only one (and somewhat superficial) complaint: where the handle meets the watering can, is also metal without rounded edges or anything to protect the metal edges. I have ripped a couple of items of clothing due to this. It annoys me, but I am aware of the issue, and I still recommend the watering can.
customer_reviews.author: J Dubs

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the price, and it looks nice in my yard if I forget to put it away.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice watering can. The only ‘negative’ thing I can say about it is that it holds so much water that when I fill it up it’s super heavy and I throw my shoulder out-LOL! So, know your limitations people! I highly recommend this product. It’s lightweight and sturdy. I have not experienced and rusting or leaking. I noticed a few other comments about rusting and leaking, but this hasn’t been the case for me.
customer_reviews.author: Cara

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Just like the '50s on the farm!
customer_reviews.text: Appears as though it will be around longer than I will. Reminds me of the 'normal' type we used to buy in 1955 for $3.56. Excellent. The 'permanent' rosette/spout is fine; if it clogs I can poke it free with a wire or blow it out with an air compressor. It was nice in the day to be able to remove the rosette (we had no word for it then) for cleaning but also, it got lost. If you fill it too high it goes out over the top instead of out the spout, but just don't fill it that high!
customer_reviews.author: M Rutkauskas

customer_reviews.title: Worthwhile Long-term Investment
customer_reviews.text: I would purchase this for myself again and it's a great gift idea for friends and family with indoor or screened patios too! This is so well made that I envision it outlasting a majority of the patio pots on my patio! The shipping was impressively fast as well. I'd be interested in taking a look-see at this company's other products. I've wondered about the maneuverability of a 5 gallon watering can because I like this one so much!! Perhaps 5 gallons might be a bit much. Anyhow, this is a purchase I'm solid happy with every day.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda J.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Watering Can
customer_reviews.text: I love this watering can. Fits a lot of water, is still very light and sturdy. I can see this lasting for many years. This saves me a lot of time when watering vegetables/flowers because I don't have to make many trips. It pours out very steady, not too hard or not too soft. It is soft enough not to damage plants, but hard enough not to bore you and make you want another can that pours faster.
customer_reviews.author: Steven6543

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something better than cheap plastic and this is it. For the price of two inferior watering cans I have one that should last the rest of my life. I’ll probably never fill it to capacity because of the weight. The moving top handle makes it fairly easy to control the flow, even when watering small pots. The size makes it a bit difficult to maneuver in tight places. At my age, I would probably be better off with a smaller capacity can, but this is working out okay for me.
customer_reviews.author: Steve V.

customer_reviews.title: Elegant looking watering can
customer_reviews.text: I love the look and finish of this can. It's smaller than i imagined for 2-1/2 gallons and if filled to the top it will spill when you tilt it in use but it does the job. It would have been nice to be able to remove the nozzle for cleaning as leaves etc can easily clog the holes, this latest model has the nose soldered on permanently. But other than that i cannot fault this can
customer_reviews.author: SFXPHIL

customer_reviews.title: False advertising.
customer_reviews.text: The holes in the head are quite small so the water flow is quite slow. I am going to drill them all out slightly to allow a greater flow. Also, in the description, it says "Manufactured in the United States". This is false, as the sticker on the can clearly states that it is made in Mexico. Overall, a solid can. That being said, it is frustrating to have to modify a new product, and to buy something under the false pretense that it is a product of the USA.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Roemer

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST WATERING CAN MONEY CAN BUY👍🏻⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
customer_reviews.text: Love it!!! This can is durable... not as heavy as I thought it would be which is a plus especially when it’s filled with over 2 gallons of water. The sprinkler head is simply perfect for watering flower beds and seedlings as the water comes out at a slow light steady stream....I am so impressed by this can that I am ordering a couple more in various sizes... Although not made in USA...actually manufactured in Mexico...The company is USA based...I highly recommend this product for all your watering needs!👍🏻⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
customer_reviews.author: Dusti Z

customer_reviews.title: Large, solid durable. Except the plastic grip on the top handle.
customer_reviews.text: Love the watering can. It is large, and has held up great. We've had it about 2 years and it is just like new, except a bit less shiny. However, the plastic grip on the top handle (the bucket style handle) is breaking off in pieces. A wooden grip, or thicker, more durable plastic one would have made this a 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: Neal

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Cans
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted! All the plastic watering cans I've owned dribble and splash out. This can provides a nice, large, gentle shower. The 2 1/2 gallon size lets me water without filling up as often, and the top bucket-style handle makes it easy to carry when full. It's also great looking.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Rip off to return!! Paid $34.28 got $21.75 back!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it, was beautiful, however not anywhere on the pot or label does it state it is stainless steel. And for that price it should be. So I returned it. Not happy, nowhere does it give the option to mail it through my own postage payment, return for $12.53! Details Behrens 208 2-Gallon Steel Watering Can Size: 2-Gallon $34.28 Refund issued-$21.75 refund issued on May 15, 2020.
customer_reviews.author: Aza

customer_reviews.title: Solid Product.  Beware of metal points!
customer_reviews.text: Solid watering can. But as other reviews noted, there are numerous weld/galvanizing protrusions that should be removed, as you can get injured on them. I filed some off, or tapped them flat with a hammer. The quality control on that aspect of the product needs fixing!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Zillman

customer_reviews.title: You may be lucky and get a better one than I.
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this can, unfortunately it was not to be. The opposing loops to which the wire handle fastens are unevenly placed, causing the can to always have a nose-down position even when empty. The plastic handle is far too small to cushion your hands when the can is full (2.5 gallons is pretty near 21 lbs.). Finally, the hot-dip was not hot enough and blobs of zinc are splashed all over the can, several were sharp enough to catch and tear skin when rubbed against with a leg.
customer_reviews.author: Gruddy

customer_reviews.title: Great watering can
customer_reviews.text: Not too big and heavy, just right for me (62 years old). I use a rain barrel and I have a small raised bed garden area on the sunny side of the house. I haven't used it over a long period of time, but so far it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Fleur

customer_reviews.title: In functional large spray pattern..
customer_reviews.text: A verry shiny with a poor/large galvanized “watering “ can. To water your outdoor potted plants you will loose halve the water due to the spray head’s large outside die spray pattern. To remove thr head or to replace it with functional US one is a “no go” since the head is fastened with 2 punch spots. So I had to epoxy the outside dia. holes to reduce the flow since a return is a bad idea one only gets another not gardener tested Mex product.
customer_reviews.author: Bert

customer_reviews.title: Much improved handle.
customer_reviews.text: I debated about purchasing because of a previous review that said the plastic handle didn't hold up. Manufacturer must have been listening because my watering can arrived with a much improved handle.
customer_reviews.author: Donna B.

customer_reviews.title: Well built watering can
customer_reviews.text: We had bought a metal can with a copper rose from Home Depot. It lasted about a year before the rose corroded. We have very hard water here. But this can looks like it will last. The handle makes it a lot easier to carry then our other can which had a fixed handle. I like how I can just hold the handle and then tip the can to water
customer_reviews.author: Steve-o

customer_reviews.title: Best watering can
customer_reviews.text: This watering can is very sturdy and well made. It will likely last for many, many years When full it is fairly heavy so people with little arm strength will need to keep this in mind. When watering plants with this can people need to be prepared to take a little time with it. Due to the large sprinkler head on the spout, the water pours out in a fairly light/paced way to allow for effective absorption.of the water into soil.
customer_reviews.author: DE

customer_reviews.title: Liked it so much I went back for a second one!
customer_reviews.text: I got sick and tired of replacing the plastic watering cans that leaked all over when I poured. Have had one of Behren's steel cans for a year and went back for a second one for the back door. Behren's is a great, American company and they make great products that last. I have many of their steel lidded containers. I was so happy to find they make watering cans. I find the handles to be very functional. These watering cans work great and are made to last!
customer_reviews.author: Monica Leone

customer_reviews.title: Tough as the nails it was forged from.
customer_reviews.text: It's a great can. Especially for what it costs. The only thing that could be improved if the handle. It's awesome for what I use it for, but if you plan to weather this thing. DO NOT expect the handle to last. Otherwise an awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Rustic charm
customer_reviews.text: Great nostalgic look for my front porch flowers. Holds enough to water them all with one trip! Only improvement that I would like would be to be able to screw off the large sprinkle head (for smaller potted plants).
customer_reviews.author: Mark music

customer_reviews.title: Behrens 208 2-Gallon Steel Watering Can
customer_reviews.text: 2-gallon size watering can saves a person from having to return to the facet to refill the water so often. Apartment, Condo or Townhouse with a small patio or yard this watering can is perfect. On trip to fill up with water ever 3 days. The best feature is leaving the watering can outside until the next fill-up and not having to worry about leakage.
customer_reviews.author: A. Bell

customer_reviews.title: Better then any I could find in local stores
customer_reviews.text: Better then any I could find in local stores. I love it for mixing my powdered Miracle Grow fertilizer. It holds a lot of water but is fairly compact. The lip in from is great because it keeps water from splashing out. The shower/spray head on it is excellent. Very gentle for water plants and seedlings. I only wish that the plastic handle was wood like the original ones were.
customer_reviews.author: J. Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Love that it holds a lot of water, does get a little heavy when you fill it but the up side is I can water everything with the one can. It also looks great sitting next to my planters. I have a much smaller one but I need to keep refilling it , I love the large size !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great - pretty light weight when empty but it seems very sturdy. The weak point is probably the little plastic protector thing on the handle, but mine hasn't broken yet (I've only used it a few times). I like that you have the capacity to carry a lot of water with you, or less if you don't need as much. Overall I'd say this is a pretty solid value. I like the spray pattern and flow rate as well.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Very big, and I'm very happy.
customer_reviews.text: The three gallon can is wonderful. No, the end does not screw off, but for those jobs I just use a hose or a regular bucket. Water comes out of the can slow enough that it easily soaks into the soil, but fast enough that you aren't standing there all day. I am buying another one so I'll be balanced when I fill them up and walk off into the wilderness, i.e. my backyard.
customer_reviews.author: K. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Can was pricey--the leaks were free...
customer_reviews.text: This watering can would have been a great buy except that it leaked in three places. For the price, I would have expected a little better quality. I had to break out the soldering iron and solder and finish the joints myself. The label said it was made in Mexico, so I guess I shouldn't have expected the highest quality. I was used to buying Behrens when it was made in the USA. If the quality doesn't improve, you should warn the public, and reduce the price. I would not buy one again unless the quality improved. Shoppers should be ready to deal with the defects.
customer_reviews.author: expects quality

customer_reviews.title: American quality is built in to this product.
customer_reviews.text: I'm trying to buy American more than ever. This unit, made in America, meets my needs big time. It's joints are reinforced with solder and I expect to get years of service from this unit. Previous $20.00 units were broken or leaked after a year or two. I thought I'd throw money at a quality unit and so far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kutzle

customer_reviews.title: 2 gallon NOT made in the USA
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 2 gallon watering can, believing it was made in the USA. The product photo clearly shows the 2 gallon can with a made in the USA sticker. The actual can I received has a made in Mexico sticker. This product is inaccurately marketed. The 2 gallon can is priced higher and was shown as a made in the USA product. I did not get what I paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best watering can on the market! I go through a ton every season but I bet this one will last several years! It is HUGE, much larger than I expected, very durable, and pours a nice and even stream of water that won't drown your plants. Most of all I love the wide mouth lip to pour the water into the watering can. This is a very well thought out product. Kuddos!
customer_reviews.author: online-shopping-addict

customer_reviews.title: Well Made, High Quality
customer_reviews.text: I don't like plastic for environmental reasons and durability. This Behrens Watering Can is made of hot-dipped steel so its really durable and won't rust. It reminds me of the watering can at my great grandfather's farm. Some things you just can't improve upon. This is one of them. I got the 2 1/2 gallon one, but it comes in different sizes. I do wish the rosehead could be unscrewed in case leaves or debris get inside the can so you could easily clean it out.
customer_reviews.author: David B Hazen

customer_reviews.title: I love this watering can
customer_reviews.text: I shopped everywhere locally for a quality watering can to apply miracle grow to my veggie garden and flower beds, and all I found was plastic. I love this watering can. I bought the 2 gallons so makes easy math to mix, it's not too heavy for me and my wife.to use, and it's got a nice wide pour that is perfect for applying miracle grow to rows or beds of plants. It even looks great sitting beside the garden if I leave it out in the rain. Love it. And it's very sturdy, so I expect to love it for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Penn

customer_reviews.title: My favorite watering can!
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this for a few days, but I love it. The way the handles are designed is user-friendly, the gentle shower it produces is just right, it holds enough for the seven large pots on our front porch (I have the 2.5 gallon one), and isn't too heavy or unwieldy for me (I'm strong for my size, but I'm only 5'2", weigh about 100 lbs. and this definitely manageable). I named it Cadillac and keep it on my front porch as decor because it's fancy. Actually not kidding. Definitely recommend. Hope it stays shiny.
customer_reviews.author: alison_eve

customer_reviews.title: Finally, no more plastic watering can!
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and worth the price! Ya, a little heavy when full, but less stops to fill it up. Was beginning to think I could find no other watering cans other than plastic! Did you know that plastic gets brittle and you'll end up with it leaking? Thank you for going back in time and making a product that will LAST! The other metal can I have is "only" 40 plus years old!
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Description said “made in US”, but product sticker says “made in Mexico”.
customer_reviews.text: I specifically bought this watering can because the description on Amazon said “Manufactured in the United States.” I just arrived, and the big sticker on the side says “Made in Mexico”. I will be returning it and finding a vintage made in USA watering can instead.
customer_reviews.author: Prime customer

customer_reviews.title: just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I really like this watering can. Since so many of the reviews said the plastic handle broke, I decided to reinforce it with duct tape. The handle is strong and more comfortable to carry the weight of the water. The can is well made.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor design.
customer_reviews.text: I don't often write negative reviews but I have to this time. When we first received this it looked like it would be great. There are few alternatives on the market that are galvanized. The issue is with the design The spray is far too wide and you can only tip it so far or the water will run over the stop. Simple adjustments in the design stage could save this but unfortunately we are more likely to make it a planter.
customer_reviews.author: ImJustSayin

customer_reviews.title: Good classic water can
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quality watering can for the garden. My wife uses it to water her raised beds that are not near a water faucet.
customer_reviews.author: Master

customer_reviews.title: Great watering can!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this watering can! I should have probably ordered a smaller size. I got the 2.5 gallon size and it's pretty huge and heavy when completely filled. Unless you have a ton of plants I'd order a smaller size.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah R. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Well made, will last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.text: Nice well made 2 gallon galvanized watering can. Only issue is holes in rosebud are too small. Easy fix, get your drill and drill ‘em out. I used a 7/64th bit to gently drill out the holes. Flows much better now. Easy Peasy Lemon Squeezy.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Charming AND durable.
customer_reviews.text: I used this beauty almost every day to water my hanging baskets and tomatoes. It holds a ton of water, is incredibly sturdy and very charming. Happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Rusts in no time
customer_reviews.text: This spout on this thing has completely rusted out after two years. I thought the whole point of galvanized metal was to prevent rust. I like the look and the capacity of this watering can, but I wish I'd gotten a plastic one instead. It's not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Knadler

customer_reviews.title: Very happy.
customer_reviews.text: I had a hard time finding a watering can. It seems like it should not have been that difficult. After a lot of looking both locally and online, I settled on this one. It works great and I particularly like the two-handle configuration. I'm not sure how you would remove the spout as some have said, but I will cross that bridge if I ever need to. It appears to be welded on. What I can say is so far, so good for me. If anything changes, I will update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria G.

customer_reviews.title: Great Watering Can, Except for the Nozzle.
customer_reviews.text: I love this Watering Can. It's probably the best one I've ever owned, with one exception. It has this nozzle attached to the spout that makes the water come out like rain. Possibly some people might like to water this way, but it takes forever for the can to empty and also if any dirt or anything else is inside the can, that just clogs up the spout. The nozzle itself has threads on it like it was meant to be screwed onto the spout, but for some reason its been welded on so it can't be removed. I ended up sawing it off and now it the Perfect Watering Can.
customer_reviews.author: Kent Walker

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Like the can, however the spout is already rusted after a month.
customer_reviews.author: Gary K.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money - durable!
customer_reviews.text: This holds a lot more water than my old watering can and it is DURABLE! I had to throw away my previous one because an overzealous 5yo managed to break it and I figured I should shell out the extra money for something tougher. I don't regret the decision! It's a solidly made product and the bonus to it holding more water is that it's too heavy for the kids to mess with it :)
customer_reviews.author: J Martin

customer_reviews.title: Very well mad watering cans.
customer_reviews.text: My old watering cans had been through a lot and were made of plastic. Neither of them had the sprayer in the end of the spout so they were just dumping water. I searched for the right watering cans and these fit the bill. Showed up quickly. They look great, are rustproof because they are galvanized, and the larger size means I can do most of my garden in two fill ups rather than 6. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Weld at the end of spout leaks water! Not happy with this failure for the price!
customer_reviews.text: The weld on the end of the spout leaks so when you pour water out a stream of water comes backwards back up the spout and dumps water on my shoes! I am going to repurpose it for a floating water faucet feature. Just need to make sure the water isn't filled to where water leaks out! Very disappointed for the price!!
customer_reviews.author: Micki W.

customer_reviews.title: well built watering can
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this is a great watering can. The only downside is I would have liked one with a little more capacity, but that is a personal issue, not a detriment to the can. I knew when I bought it that it was only a 2 gallon can.
customer_reviews.author: Docwas

customer_reviews.title: Good watering can, but I wish!
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a good product. It is made well and serves specified, appropriate need however, I wish the sprinkler head could be detached. It appears to screw on, but there is an indentation that prevents the head from being screwed off. I want to be able to pour from time to time rather than sprinkle.
customer_reviews.author: Fredrick L. C

customer_reviews.title: Very durable
customer_reviews.text: I use this in combination with a 55 gallon rain barrel so I don't need to pay for water for my gardens (aside from the initial investment in the barrel and the can obviously). It is much much more durable than the plastic ones I've had previously, which have had problems with the handles breaking or the spouts coming loose. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Jones

customer_reviews.title: Simple design and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a "working", more traditional watering can without the frills. The screw-on nozzle not surprisingly leaked just a bit at the connection. Easily fixed with Blue Monster PTFE Pipe Thread Sealant Tape. Very pleased with this can.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Hiker

customer_reviews.title: Handles Well
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to use as a sprinkler water can for my outside lawn plants. I have a few plants and not an entire garden, so a regular water isn't needed, and besides, I don't have an outside faucet to enable a water hose. I'm glad that the pail is beautiful to look at and easy to carry. It is made well in that all the parts are welded and eliminates breaking off at a later date. It wasn't cheap, but I won't have to replace it for a very long time, if then.
customer_reviews.author: lili

customer_reviews.title: It leaks of course.
customer_reviews.text: It leaks of course, because who would want a watering can that didn't leak. The leak is around the crimped on piece that the rosette head screws onto. Nothing that a little silicone cant fix but why buy something that you need to fix before you can use it. And yes the rosette head does unscrew off but it is put on with some kind of sealant (go figure). Other than the frustration it is an well made can with a large opening for filling up.
customer_reviews.author: Tony the Butcher

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.  Best thing I've bought this year.
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. This is exactly what I was looking for in a watering can. Galvanized steel, big, sturdy, with a nice, big spray. When my potential grandson finally inherits it, it might be ready to serve as a planter, but it's got several decades of real work to do first, and it looks up to the job.
customer_reviews.author: D. L. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Great Waterer
customer_reviews.text: Have been looking for a good solid metal watering can and this one is the best I have ever seen. Might be a little heavy but I have no problem with it. Highly recommend it for someone wanting a metal watering can that seems like it will last a good number of years.
customer_reviews.author: Nolan C. Babcock

customer_reviews.title: Leaks at the spout!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible! Brand new watering can? Leaks at the spout, as water trickles down the can and drips at the front base. I expect a new product to NOT leak when I use it the first time. Very disappointing
customer_reviews.author: rusty

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: We live in the desert and have found that plastic watering cans just don't stand up to the sun and heat. We are quite sure that this watering can will outlast anything we've had in the past. Aside from the durability, we've found it to be very easy to handle in the yard. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: M. Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Love how much it holds!
customer_reviews.text: This is really nice for watering outdoor plants during the cooler Fall/early Winter months when our sprinklers be been winterized for 5 months. Love the size!
customer_reviews.author: Lesley Pulsipher Gulledge

customer_reviews.title: Great Planter
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for different options for adding some color to my front yard - these made perfect, cost effective flower pots. I just drilled a couple of holes in the bottom for drainage and added an assortment of flowers. These watering cans highlight the flowers with the fun shape and these cans will last forever and are very easy to clean for next years' flowers.
customer_reviews.author: 2 Dogs R Us

customer_reviews.title: Strange "shower head" pattern...but well made construction.
customer_reviews.text: Seems really solid, just like all the other Behren products I have owned. Never been disappointed with one of their trash cans, wash tubs, etc. The only "complaint" (if you can really call it that) is that the "shower" pattern (if that's what you call it???) is a bit wonky. Not really sure how to describe it, but the water spreads out (in different directions) much further than on other watering cans I have had. Having said that, it's not a deal breaker and overall, I like it a lot. Reminds my of a watering can my grandmother had.
customer_reviews.author: MJC

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: The plastic ones you get at W**mart for $5 hold up for maybe one year of use before they disintegrate and you have to buy a new one. Rather than add to plastic trash to the environment, metal seemed the way to go. My mom has the same galvanized can her dad used over 50 years ago. This thing is about the same quality as Grandpa's, so here's hoping it lasts a long time. Seems to have a better "pour pattern" than the cheapies, too.
customer_reviews.author: Ford Person

customer_reviews.title: DRILL OUT HOLES
customer_reviews.text: Great can, I ordered two of them and I am glad I did... Only issue is I use pond water to water everything because I do not want to kill the mycorrhizae with city water. So I used 7/64 bit and drilled out all the holes on the spigot... Now I can empty this thing way faster BUT NOT TO FAST TO WASH ALL SOIL AWAY. Perfect now!
customer_reviews.author: xreadx

customer_reviews.title: Love love love this watering can
customer_reviews.text: Pricy but great quality. My mom had a galvanized watering can that last years that is why I bought this one and not another plastic one. I leave it sitting out to catch rain water also for our water is heavy chlorinated and my plants do not like the chlorine.
customer_reviews.author: Reba Haggard Brown

customer_reviews.title: the metal is a nice quality - this would be a good decorative item
customer_reviews.text: Holds a lot, but the sprinkler isn't removable when it could be. Prone to clogging. The sprinkler doesn't have a lot of holes, and they are very small - so it pours very slowly. Water frequently spills over the front when tilting it forward. Otherwise, the metal is a nice quality - this would be a good decorative item. If you want to use it for actual watering, you could probably do better with a plastic jug. Alternatively, you could drill a few more holes in the sprinkler, as it seems there is enough room for more, they just didn't put them in.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and just what I wanted. Big enough to get most jobs done but not so big as to get too heavy. I compared to some at the local farm store and it was made of a heavier metal. Not sure if it is made in America but the others were not.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Good build quality, but with two problems
customer_reviews.text: 1) The spout disperses water in too wide a pattern. I bought it to put water from my rain barrel to the roots of my blueberry bushes. The dispersal pattern is a foot wide.2) The side handle is formed by bending two medal pieces together which creates a sharp line where they join. I almost need to use gloves to prevent the discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: Robert N Weinberg

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: The product is a well made heavy duty watering can. I will get many years of service with it. My only negative, minor, is that the wire handle ends where it attaches to the can has the ends bent out. These ends tend to snag on the trellises and tomato cages and my belt loops. But overall a great product.
customer_reviews.author: James m

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for. One great watering can
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased many plastic watering cans. Its almost a bi yearly thing. Finally broke down a purchase this one and I can tell you it will last for years. Holes allow just the right amount of water, doesn't flood the plants like the cheap plastic ones. Reminds me of the one my Grandfather used for 20 plus years.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D.

customer_reviews.title: Beautifully balanced and keeps the water clean.
customer_reviews.text: This watering can is terrific. Not much to say about a metal handle on a heavy object but this pail is nicely balanced. Easy to tip and pour all the way to the last drop. Stainless steel is a good feature; no contamination for my organic vegetable garden.
customer_reviews.author: BLC

customer_reviews.title: Spend the money and get the last watering can you need for your lifetime, you wont regret it.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! We have purchased plastic watering cans before this and they all leaked and really did a terrible job of doing their single job at life... watering plants. This think kicks butt! It works great every time and best of all, it doesn't leak! Spend the money and get the last watering can you need for your lifetime, you wont regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: When Quality Counts...
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as offered. Well packaged, arrived in A-1 condition. No dents, no leaks, all seams hold solid even when filled with water and sitting for days. Looks great perched on the porch or patio. We are extremely happy with the quality of the product, the flawless delivery and the timeless galvanized metal appearance.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Lent

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy watering can. I love it. Even full of water it is easy to carry and use. It is so sturdy that I lean on it to reach a watering spigot and it supports my substantial weight.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super expensive for a watering can that is  basically a decoration!
customer_reviews.text: Completely pointless to have a watering can where you can’t remove the rose. If you’re somebody who knows how to use a tool you would find the fact that you cannot do this to be intensely annoying and irritating. Plus if anything ever clogs up the little holes good luck trying to clean it out. So stupid. I guess if you want to stick dried flowers in it - maybe. But wow what a price . Returning it what a waste of time ordering it and having to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen A. Byrnes

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: I would have liked to give this classic a better review, bit the welding/soldering was terrible. It arrived with three leaks. We happen to know a fabulous welder, and he spent an hour fixing it, so I now how a pretty good watering can.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Lascher

customer_reviews.title: Real watering cans!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a landscape architect and landscape contractor, and I bought this one to match my other watering can as you should always have two cans to balance out your back. It works just fine, but it would be nice if the handles were a bit beefier. Over time they get squashed a bit and have to be straighten, but they do last! I really don't like plastic watering cans as they always seen to crack, blow out of my truck or just never last. Behrens does offer replacement roses which is very nice.
customer_reviews.author: The Mule

customer_reviews.title: Water pitcher
customer_reviews.text: Good metal quality. Doesn’t rust. Perhaps you could adjust the upper handle for comfort more. The thin plastic handle is harsh. It is well offset by the side grab bar handle.
customer_reviews.author: gumby4yoga

customer_reviews.title: Well Made
customer_reviews.text: This product is well made, study and built to last. I use it to water potted plants. I like the larger size so I can fill it with as much or as little as I need to water.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Durable but poor design
customer_reviews.text: This watering can is sturdy; older fashioned Beware, the head does not come off; the holes are too small and had to enlarge with a nail The plastic round handle is does not look very durable. Generally would not buy again. Try Home Depot Vigoro 2 gal metal for less money and much better design.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Big enough to take care of your plants in one trip!!
customer_reviews.text: Big enough to take care of your plants in one trip!! I have a small watering can that I had to make several trips to the water spicket. This can allows a one trip deal. It’s also a very pretty ornament in my flower bed. Love it
customer_reviews.author: Angie

product_meta.title: Behrens 210 2-1/2-Gallon Steel Watering Can, Silver
product_meta.description: Size:2-1/2-GallonBehrens 2-1/2-Gallon hot dipped steel Watering can gives you the strength and durability of steel with a Vintage/classic look. the steel won't absorb odors, won't rust and is fully recyclable.The rosehead is not intended to be removed from the watering can and can cause damage if removal is attempted.
feature_bullets: Durable the strength of steel; Weather resistant won't rust
Dimensions: 19-1/2-inch w by 11-inch d by 14-inch h, wt: 4.7-pound

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,839 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
